item.title: Roblox: Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes
  • How to Redeem Wild Rails Tower Defense
  • How to Get More Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes

Wild Rails Tower Defense invites players to plunge into the cruel and dangerous world of the Wild West. But instead of exploring it, you have to defend yourself from waves of various zombies, werewolves, and other creatures who want you dead. Fortunately, players can call units to defend stages, although their call costs Bonds. To earn money faster, you should use Wild Rails Tower Defense codes.

Codes grant you useful goodies from the developers, such as extra money or boosters. But of course, their validity period is limited in this Roblox TD experience.

All Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes

Working Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes

  • 10KMEMBERS - Redeem this code to get Bond Boosts
  • RAILS - Redeem this code to get 100 Bonds
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get 150 Bonds
  • EASTER2025 - Redeem this code to get 200 Eggs
  • Gander - Redeem this code to get 250 Bonds

Expired Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes

There are no expired codes in Wild Rails Tower Defense . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

When you first join Wild Rails Tower Defense , you will only have 1 unit, namely Torcher. And while it is enough to clear the first stages, you will need more different characters on more difficult levels. So at first, your goal will be to earn Bonds needed to summon units. Usually, this can be done by winning levels. But if you want to save a significant amount of time, then Wild Rails Tower Defense codes are what you need.

Most of these codes will reward you with up to 250 Bonds. But some of them can contain boosters that will double the money you get on stages. So you should redeem the codes before they expire and the rewards become no longer available.

How to Redeem Wild Rails Tower Defense

Luckily, the code redemption feature in Wild Rails Tower Defense works no more difficult than in other Roblox experiences. It is available from the first seconds of the game, so you can earn extra money even before you start your first battle. And for convenience, we recommend you follow these steps:

  • Launch Wild Rails Tower Defense .
  • Next, you need to open the Shop by clicking on the corresponding button on the left side of the screen.
  • Then scroll down to the Codes section.
  • Finally, enter the code and click Redeem to get free goodies.

How to Get More Wild Rails Tower Defense Codes

To stay up to date with all the latest Wild Rails Tower Defense codes, we recommend bookmarking this guide. As with other Roblox articles, we will update it over time. Players can also visit the developers' official media pages. There you will find all the news about updates, events, and of course, Roblox codes:

  • Wild Rails TD Discord server
  • TOP 100 GAME Roblox group

item.title: Rumor: New Nier Game Potentially in Development
item.description:
Summary

  • The original Nier creators are collaborating on a new project, and many believe it could be a new entry in the series.
  • Square Enix recently celebrated Nier's 15th anniversary with a livestream, teasing a new novel, upcoming concerts, and merch.

The original creative leaders of the Drakengard franchise's spinoff series are working on a new game together, and many suspect it could be a third mainline Nier title. The original Nier was released in 2010, but it was its 2017 follow-up, Nier: Automat,a that largely put the series on the map. Since then, a 2021 remaster of the original title, named Nier Replicant, helped get new fans up to speed on the origins of the spinoff series, and Nier Reincarnation was released that same year on mobile but was shut down in 2024.

This year, the Nier series is having its 15th anniversary. To celebrate, publisher Square Enix hosted a two-hour livestream a few weeks ago where many were expecting news about what's next for the beloved action series. Instead, Square announced the launch of Nier's 15th anniversary website, which serves as a hub of information about the new online novel named Undecided Option , a series of live Nier: Orchestra concert dates, new merchandise, and more. The stream ended with a 20-minute musical performance celebrating Nier 's beloved soundtrack.

While Square Enix's 15th anniversary livestream left many Nier fans wanting more, there seems to be a new rumor about the core creative members of the spinoff series who've banded together on a new project. Well-known Japanese games insider Genki pointed to a piece by Famitsu in which series producer Yosuke Saito confirmed that both Nier games' director Yoko Taro, musical composer Keiichi Okabe, and former PlatinumGames designer Takahisa Taura are working together once again on an unannounced project. While it's not known for certain whether it's a new Nier installment, many fans of the franchise suspect that it very well could be.

Original Nier Creatives Working Together on New Game

The IP rights of both Drakengard and Nier belong to Square Enix and, as such, Taro, Okabe, and Taura would have to work with Square as the publisher of a potential new Nier game. The real challenge would be finding a studio to develop the game, as PlatinumGames seems to be busy with its own projects. After departing from Platinum, Taura has just recently founded his own studio named Eel Game Studio. It wouldn't make sense for Taura to work on an external project as he's building up his own game studio, so there's a good chance this new Yoko Taro mystery game could be developed at Eel Game Studio, though this is merely speculation.

If this potential new Nier game is indeed an Eel Game Studio production, it would mean the game is several years away, as the studio is likely still in the throes of hiring talent. Even so, a brief, 30-second CGI teaser wouldn't be too unusual to see this year. Perhaps in the meantime, Square Enix may finally release a Drakengard remaster trilogy, as all three games are still locked away on PlayStation 2 and 3.

item.title: Fallout 5 Might Want to Watch One Part of The Outer Worlds 2 Closely
item.description:
Summary

  • The Outer Worlds 2 introduces TTD, giving players new ways to strategically target enemies.
  • The game enhances combat with power sliding, offering increased mobility and cool factor.
  • Fallout-inspired TTD and V.A.T.S. mechanics could influence the evolution of RPG shooters.

The Outer Worlds 2 is slated for release later this year, and the developers at Obsidian Entertainment have spoiled fans with gameplay footage and deep dives into some of the new features the game has to offer. The Outer Worlds 2 takes plenty from its predecessor, and much like the legacy series from which it draws much inspiration, it is looking to take the critically acclaimed RPG shooter to new heights.

Obsidian is best known for Fallout: New Vegas , a standalone built on Bethesdas Fallout 3 engine. Regarded as one of the best RPGs of its era, it helped that Obsidian is composed of the developers who made Fallout for Interplay. One major feature from Fallout , the Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System (V.A.T.S.), was the main inspiration for a feature in The Outer Worlds .

The Outer Worlds 2's TTD vs. Fallout's V.A.T.S.

Tactical Time Dilation (TTD) slows time, allowing the player to pinpoint weak spots and obtain special bonuses when attacking enemies. In-universe, it is also known as skip flu, as its a side effect of extended hibernation, such as during interstellar travel. Much like The Stranger from The Outer Worlds , the protagonist known either as the Earth Directorate Agent, the Agent, or the Commander of The Outer Worlds 2 is coming to the Arcadia Star System from afar, meaning they will likely spend some time in hibernation. Its still unclear whether their TTD will be a result of interstellar travel or a result of the rifts in spacetime that make up the backbone of The Outer Worlds 2 s story.

Some of the cooler features shown in The Outer Worlds 2 gameplay are the new ways that TTD can be utilized. In one clip, the player tosses a grenade from cover, goes into TTD, and shoots the grenade midair over an enemys head. Grenades were not present in the first The Outer Worlds , but this feature was present in some form in Fallout 3 and Fallout 4 , where the player could throw a grenade, go into VATS mode, and target the grenade with their firearm, granted that they had enough accuracy and luck.

One thing Fallout doesnt have, and has never had, is power sliding. It's one of many mechanics used in modern shooters that gives players extra maneuverability through the environment. The Outer Worlds lacked this feature as well, but not anymore. Later in the same clip from The Outer Worlds 2 , the player power slides from a running start, and then once again while sliding tosses a grenade, goes into TTD, and shoots the grenade midair. It shows that the player has much more freedom in how they can mix and match skills to achieve a certain outcome and up the cool factor.

Bethesdas Fallout 3 played with a more shooter-oriented style over the isometric point-and-click style of Interplay's original Fallout games. Obsidian honored and improved on Bethesdas vision for Fallout by adding aim-down-sight (ADS) to the guns in Fallout: New Vegas . Fallout 4 leaned even further into the shooter by improving the gun mechanics, adding sprint, and making it so that V.A.T.S. slows time rather than stops it.

What TTD's Evolution in The Outer Worlds 2 Means for V.A.T.S. in Fallout 5

With that in mind, Bethesda is likely to stay on that road with Fallout 5 , looking for more ways to evolve and position it as a modern RPG shooter. One of the best ways it could do that is by providing more maneuverability for the player, particularly inside V.A.T.S. It could be that the player characters ability to do things like power slide and shoot grenades in V.A.T.S. are tied into their Perception and Agility S.P.E.C.I.A.L. stats and associated perks, as Fallout 4 changed it so that Perception now affects V.A.T.S. accuracy.

item.title: Epic Games Store Reveals 2 Free Games for May 8
item.description:
Summary

  • Epic Games Store's current free game is Super Space Club.
  • Super Space Club is also the free mobile game this week.
  • Deadtime Defenders and Touch Type Tale will be free May 8 to May 15.

Epic Games Store users can claim Deadtime Defenders and Touch Type Tale for free from May 8 to May 15. Epic Games Store users are treated to new freebies on a weekly basis. Those that have made sure to claim the free games every week should have a huge digital library full of games that cost them absolutely nothing.

The current Epic Games Store free game is Super Space Club . A lo-fi arcade space shooter, Super Space Club was first released in 2023 and has earned a "Positive" overall review rating on Steam. Epic Games Store users interested in checking it have until Thursday, May 8 at 10am CT to snag it. At that point, Super Space Club will be cycled out of the Epic Games Store free games lineup and replaced with two new freebies.

From May 8 to May 15, Epic Games Store users will be able to claim Deadtime Defenders and Touch Type Tale for their digital libraries. Deadtime Defenders is a single-player side-scrolling looter-shooter with RPG elements and customization thrown in the mix for good measure. Similar to Super Space Club , Deadtime Defenders has a "Positive" overall rating. Touch Type Tale , meanwhile, is described as a "strategic typing" with a single-player mode and online PvP. Touch Type Tale was first released in 2024 and has earned "Very Positive" reviews. Based on the reception the games have enjoyed, it seems as though next week will be a fairly solid one for the Epic Games Store.

Epic Games Store Free Games for May 2025

  • Super Space Club (May 1 - May 8)
  • Deadtime Defenders (May 8 - May 15)
  • Touch Type Tale (May 8 - May 15)

While the Epic Games Store's main focus remains on PC, it's worth pointing out that the digital storefront has expanded to the mobile arena as well. Epic Games Store gives away free mobile games every week alongside its PC offerings. This time around, mobile gamers can claim the mobile version of Super Space Club . Like the PC version, Super Space Club will be free to Epic Games Store mobile users until May 8. It's possible next week's freebies will be the same on PC and mobile, but there's also a chance the free mobile game offerings will be unique, so fans will have to stay tuned and see what happens.

It's possible that this coming week will have even more freebies for Epic Games Store users to claim than what's been announced. A free Star Wars game has been teased for the Epic Games Store, but it was not revealed in the latest update. It's possible that the free Star Wars game will drop on Sunday, May 4, but that remains to be seen. For now, Epic Games Store users can claim Super Space Club and look forward to Deadtime Defenders and Touch Type Tale on May 8.

item.title: Skyrim Dev Comments on Loading Screens in Bethesda Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Loading screens in Bethesda games are necessary to track items and physics.
  • Skyrim developer Bruce Nesmith explained that attempts to hide loading screens led to performance issues.
  • The success of Oblivion Remastered has led to a rise in Skyrim's player count.

Skyrim developer Bruce Nesmith recently talked about why The Elder Scrolls games have so many loading screens, explaining that they are an unfortunate necessity for the games design. Segmented map design has been criticized in Skyrim and Starfield countless times before, and Nesmith's explanation at least points out why the developers have no choice but to do it.

Released in 2011, Skyrim is one of the most popular games of all time. Across multiple editions, Skyrim has sold over 60 million copies, making it one of the best-selling games in the entire history of the medium. Developer Bruce Nesmith worked extensively on both Oblivion and Skyrim , and finally left Bethesda shortly before the release of Starfield .

In a recent interview with VideoGamer, Nesmith explained that while gamers prefer to explore a seamless world, the loading screens in Bethesdas games are important to keep track of item placement and detailed physics, which can stay after a gamer leaves one room. According to the developer, Bethesda simply didnt have a choice, and every attempt to hide loading screens or make the titles more seamless was met with huge performance issues, essentially making games worse. Nesmith explained that its not that the devs were lazy or didn't want to address gamers' complaints, but it was certifiably impossible to create the complex, beautiful games that Bethesda sought to make without using loading screens.

Skyrim Developer Explains Why Loading Screens Are Necessary in Elder Scrolls Games

This is not the first time that developers have talked about the loading screens in Bethesda games. Late last year, Starfield dev Nate Purkeypile touched on a similar point, saying that while Starfield did not have so many loading screens during development, they were likely added to improve the games overall performance.

Skyrim and the entire Elder Scrolls franchise have been in the spotlight again now that Oblivion Remastered has been released. Oblivion Remastered reached over four million players in only three days, with the long-rumored title celebrating an incredibly successful launch.

Due to Oblivion Remastered s release, gamers have been returning to some other Bethesda games. Reports have indicated that Skyrim s player count has risen by at least 28% this month. After gamers finish playing Oblivion Remastered , even more of them may return to the popular title as they wait for the release of The Elder Scrolls 6 , which does not have an official release date yet, and is not expected before 2027. Hopefully, TES 6 will not have as many loading screens as Starfield , but its still hard to tell, as essentially nothing about the upcoming title has already been revealed to the public yet.
